name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Caitlin Clark Indiana Fever

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Caitlin Clark Indiana Fever is inspired by Caitlin Clark’s WNBA team, the Indiana Fever, this colorway packs heat with a midnight navy upper, bright crimson detailing, and sharp hits of university gold. What started as a player exclusive in 2024 has now made its way to shelves, turning heads on and off the court, and even showing up on NBA hardwoods during the Finals.

Design-wise, this pair brings performance and flair together in classic Kobe 5 Protro fashion. The high-gloss finish gives it a slick, almost liquid-like shine under lights, while gradient swooshes and Kobe’s heel signature add just enough edge to keep it fresh. Inside, the sneaker’s Zoom Air cushioning and lightweight build deliver the responsiveness hoopers crave. Whether you’re making cuts or styling fits, this sneaker delivers on every front.

Released on June 30, 2025, the Nike Kobe 5 Protro Caitlin Clark Indiana Fever dropped at a retail price of $190. This colorway made up of midnight navy, bright crimson, and university gold, tells a story of grit, hype, and breaking barriers. A rare public release for a player-exclusive pair, this drop is a win for fans, collectors, and anyone who appreciates game-changing energy.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba Eggplant

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba Eggplant celebrates Kobe Bryant's legacy with a design inspired by the elegance and wisdom of the snake in Chinese culture. Wrapped in a stunning metallic purple upper, the sneaker exudes power and poise, while black accents and a translucent outsole add layers of depth to its aesthetic. The iconic swoosh is accented by a golden snake that appears on the side of the upper, paying homage to Bryant's Mamba mentality both on and off the court.

Engineered for performance, the Kobe 5 Protro combines cutting-edge cushioning with a supportive fit. The addition of snakeskin details along the heel and upper adds texture and character to the design, while its streamlined silhouette ensures agility and speed. Perfectly balancing style and functionality, this pair is a tribute to Bryant’s enduring influence in sports and culture.

Set to release on January 9, 2025, the Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba Eggplant will retail for $190. Whether you’re on the court or collecting for nostalgia, this sneaker is a celebration of Kobe's legacy and his transformative spirit.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro X-Ray is a vibrant homage to Kobe Bryant's legendary career, taking inspiration from the iconic X-ray T-shirt that featured his hand adorned with five championship rings. Reimagining this concept, the X-ray design is applied to the upper of the Kobe 5 with glow in the dark elements, depicting an X-ray of a foot. Done in deep royal blue, baltic blue, and glacier blue, this bold sneaker also features glow-in-the-dark outsoles, adding an extra layer of flair to an already striking silhouette.

As part of the Protro series, this Kobe 5 combines modern performance technology with the original model's design, making it a favorite among basketball players and sneakerheads alike. Known for its sleek, low-profile build, the Kobe 5 has been a go-to for athletes seeking speed, agility, and responsiveness. This latest iteration takes the iconic silhouette and elevates it with a design that truly celebrates the Mamba Mentality and Kobe’s enduring influence on the game.

Released on October 17, 2024, the Nike Kobe 5 Protro X-Ray retailed for $190. This special edition release, with its unique X-ray graphic, glow-in-the-dark elements, and tribute to Kobe's incredible career, is a must-have for fans of Kobe Bryant and those who appreciate bold, innovative designs.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Year of the Mamba Eggplant (GS)

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Year of the Mamba Eggplant (GS) is a striking tribute to the legendary Kobe Bryant, designed specifically for young athletes. This Grade School edition showcases a bold eggplant purple upper, accented with sleek black details and luxurious metallic gold accents. The shoe's design seamlessly blends style and performance, featuring Nike's innovative technologies to provide superior comfort and support on the court.

Engineered with the needs of growing athletes in mind, this Kobe 5 model offers exceptional responsiveness and lightweight construction. The shoe's low-profile silhouette allows for quick cuts and agile movements, while the durable outsole ensures excellent traction during intense gameplay. With its eye-catching colorway and premium materials, this sneaker is not only a high-performance basketball shoe but also a fashionable statement piece for young Kobe fans.

Us at StockX believe this product is great for aspiring young basketball players who want to emulate Kobe's on-court excellence while showcasing their style off the court.

In grade school sizes, the Nike Kobe 5 X-Ray (GS) is a sneaker featuring a Deep Royal Blue, Baltic Blue, and Glacier Blue upper. The upper displays printed artwork of foot bones, in the style of an X-ray image, across the quarter, accented by the Swoosh. Kobe branding appears on the tongue and heel, and the Deep Royal Blue midsole and Glacier Blue outsole finish the look.

American athletic brand Nike is known for outfitting the top NBA players with signature shoes, and they worked with Kobe Bryant from the early 2000s. The Nike Kobe series is known for its bold and forward-leaning aesthetic, with the occasional out-there design, such as the 5 X-Ray, which surely stands alone.

Our experts feel that the 5 X-Ray's best feature is its edgy and unique imagery. Cross laces help little ones put them on. The Nike Kobe 5 X-Ray (GS) was released on October 17, 2024, and retailed for $120.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated Hall of Fame

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated Hall of Fame arrives in gold, purple, and black, a colorway that pays homage to the Mamba and his Lakers legacy. The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated Hall of Fame features a gold-colored, textured upper with mesh toe boxes and side paneling. Snakeskin-textured overlays add nuance on the tops, and each shoe is accented with a purple Swoosh on the right side panel and pink Swoosh on the left, with the numbers 24, 10, and 8 inscribed on the pink Swoosh. Below, Zoom Air provides additional cushioning.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated Hall of Fame was released in May, 2021, at a retail price of $190.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba University Red

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba University Red is a vibrant celebration of Kobe Bryant’s legacy and the 2025 Lunar New Year. Inspired by the Year of the Snake, this sneaker features a bold university red base with gold details and intricate snake motifs that pay homage to Kobe’s "Black Mamba" nickname. A golden snake wraps around the sides, while metallic gold accents highlight the toe box, heel, and tongue logo.

The textured snakeskin pattern on the collar gives the sneaker a luxurious edge, complementing the bold design. Black swoosh logos and a durable black rubber outsole ground the shoe with striking contrast, ensuring it’s as functional as it is stylish. Packed with Protro performance updates, this iteration stays true to Kobe’s ethos of innovation and excellence.

Released on January 18, 2025, the Nike Kobe 5 Protro Year of the Mamba University Red retailed for $190. This pair dropped exclusively in China to celebrate Kobe Bryant’s enduring impact and the joy and fortune associated with the Lunar New Year.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro (2020) 5 Rings celebrates Kobe Bryant's legacy with a rerelease of a shoe that originally came out in 2010. Nike first released the Kobe 5 Protro after Bryant won his fifth NBA championship with the Los Angeles Lakers. Along with other championship motifs, Bryant's signature appears in bright gold on the heel.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro (2020) 5 Rings features colorful, graffiti-like writing across the upper. The number 5 appears multiple times on the upper. Highlighted by the white sole, this sneaker starts with bright blue and gradually fades into golden yellow with a blue cap over the toe. More graffiti-like writing appears on the inner sole.

Nike Kobe 5 Protro (2020) 5 Rings released in October of 2020 and retailed for $180.

In honor of Mamba Day on 8/24 in 2020, Nike released a new colorway of the Kobe V Protro with the Kobe V Protro Lakers. The Kobe Protro series focuses on taking early Nike Kobe designs and modifying them with upgraded technology and materials so that performance never ages out.

Reminiscent of the original Kobe 5 Lakers Away colorway, the Kobe V Protro Lakers pays homage to Kobe’s monumental career with the Lakers. It features a regal purple upper embedded with FlyWire, plus black overlays and Del Sol detailing. A white midsole, icy translucent outsole, and black Swoosh coordinate so perfectly that they are worthy of a #1 seed in the NBA Playoffs.

The Kobe V Protro Lakers released in August of 2020 and retailed for $180.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Year of the Mamba University Red (GS)

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Year of the Mamba University Red (GS) is a bold grade school sized release that honors both Kobe Bryant’s legacy and the 2025 Lunar New Year in striking style.

Dressed in a vibrant university red, black, and metallic gold palette, this special edition Nike Kobe 5 sneaker in grade school sizing takes inspiration from the Year of the Snake and Kobe’s iconic "Black Mamba" persona. A golden snake graphic integrates with the eyelets and black Swoosh on the lateral side of the university red upper. Metallic gold accents shine across the toe box and tongue logo. A snakeskin-textured collar adds depth and luxury, reinforcing the theme. Black Swooshes and a durable black rubber outsole anchor the design with sharp contrast.

Launched exclusively in China on January 18, 2025, for $120, we love the snake theme details and how the grade school Nike Kobe 5 Year of the Mamba University Red (GS) celebrates heritage, excellence, and the spirit of the Lunar New Year.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Big Stage Parade pays homage to Kobe Bryant's fifth championship title in 2010 as well as the basketball star's legendary career. This sneaker combines design elements from the Big Stage and Parade colorways to create a double-sided shoe with two wildly different patterns. As a final homage, the footwear references the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Parade that Nike gifted the basketball legend in 2010. But instead of blue, the Nike Kobe 5 Protro Big Stage/Parade uses black and metallic gold to celebrate two of the Lakers' classic colors.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Big Stage Parade released in August of 2020 and retailed for $200.

Known as one of the most coveted Kobe colorways of all time, the Kobe V Bruce Lee made a come back in 2020. The Kobe V Bruce Lee originally debuted in 2010, the year that Kobe won his final championship. This week, Nike is adding this iconic colorway to its Protro series, a Kobe line that meshes retro silhouettes with modified cushioning and construction.

The Kobe V Protro Bruce Lee is inspired by two classic Bruce Lee films, Game of Death and Enter the Dragon. Black and Yellow paneling on the upper pays homage to the one-piece jumpsuit that Lee wore in Game of Death (famously duplicated in Kill Bill), while the red scratch marks on the lateral side pay tribute to the final fight sequence from Enter The Dragon.

The Kobe V Bruce Lee Protro released in November of 2020 for $180.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Bruce Lee Alternate

details.description:
If you thought the legendary Kobe V Bruce Lee would get a reissue without anything else special lined up, you must have underestimated the importance of this occasion. In addition to the Kobe V Protro Bruce Lee, Nike released a brand new colorway inspired by Bruce Lee with the Kobe V Protro Bruce Lee Alternate.

The Kobe V Protro Alternative Bruce Lee delivers a black and white take on the original. Black and white paneling comprise the upper while hits of red can be seen outlining the Swoosh and on the lateral side scratch marks, tributing Enter the Dragon. A white and black Zoom sole, yellow heel cushioning, and silver Kobe branding on the tongue completes this alternate design.

The Kobe V Protro Alt Bruce Lee released in November of 2020 for $180.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If Pack

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If Pack features a white mesh upper with golden Swooshes on the right shoe and a black mesh upper with golden Swooshes on the left shoe. From there, a two-toned, textured forefoot and a translucent, cushioned outsole complete the design.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If Pack released in August of 2020 and retailed for $390.

name: Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If White

details.description:
The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If White is a distinctive piece in the exclusive Nike Kobe line that honors Bryant's legacy and unyielding tenacity on the basketball court.

The Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated is constructed with a combination of synthetic and textile materials on the upper, providing both flexibility and durability. The design of the upper showcases a blend of scales and patterns, a nod to Kobe's "Black Mamba" moniker. The outsole boasts a herringbone traction pattern for optimal grip, while the midsole integrates Nike's Zoom Air cushioning for responsive feedback. It features the Undefeated logo, symbolizing the collaboration between the brand and Bryant's legacy. The predominantly white colorway is highlighted with accents inspired by the Undefeated brand.

What our experts appreciate about the Nike Kobe 5 Protro Undefeated What If White is the Protro model Nike has included its Zoom Turbo technology. As a result, it provides more stability than its predecessor. This shoe released on 27th August 2020 for $190.

Nike welcomed in the holidays by bringing back the Kobe 5 Protro Chaos, now available on StockX. The Kobe 5 Chaos colorway originally released in 2009 and drew inspiration from the late Heath Ledger’s iconic Joker character in "The Dark Knight". As part of the Kobe Protro series, Nike modified the original Kobe 5 design with upgraded technology and materials.

This Kobe 5 Protro is composed of a chameleon FlyWire upper with white and charcoal overlays. A white midsole with red speckles, lime green outsole, and lime green Swoosh completes the design. These sneakers released in December of 2019 and retailed for $175.

details.colorway: Forest Green/Metallic Red Bronze-Speed Yellow-Forest Green
details.description:
In honor of Mamba Day on 8/24 in 2020, Nike released a new colorway of the Kobe V Protro with the Kobe V Protro Girls EYBL. The Kobe Protro series focuses on taking early Nike Kobe designs and modifying them with upgraded technology and materials so that performance never ages out.

The Kobe V Protro Girls EYBL draws inspiration from the most monstrous Gorgon in Greek mythology, Medusa. The stories say that with just one glance, Medusa could turn her foes to stone. Luckily with the right handles, it doesn’t take superpowers to freeze defenders in their steps. The upper on this Kobe V consists of dark grey FlyWire with subtle snake graphics visible on each panel. Striking white accents, yellow and orange interior detailing, and co-branded embroidery on the tongue adds the finishing touches to this Mamba masterpiece.

The Kobe V Protro Girls EYBL released in August of 2020 and retailed for $180.
